author: Staff Reporter
text:
There was no tsunami threat to the coastal villages of Kanyakumari district and hence no alert had been issued, said Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan here on Wednesday night.

Coastal villages of the district were devastated during the 2004 tsunami, in which over 850 people died and many were injured.

An earthquake of 8.2 magnitudes struck some 600 km off the southwest coast of Sumthra island of Indonesia around 12.49 p.m. GMT on Wednesday at a depth of 10 km.
title: “No tsunami threat to Kanyakumari villages”
